intro: Euchiton pulchellus, commonly known as the showy evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. The botanical features of Euchiton pulchellus make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
